ChatGPT's Memory Feature Supercharges Prompt Injection

Tech 5 min read

The Verge article titled "ChatGPT's Memory Feature Supercharges Prompt Injection" discusses how OpenAI's introduction of a memory feature in ChatGPT enhances the potency of prompt injection attacks. With this new feature, ChatGPT remembers information between sessions, allowing for a more personalized user experience. However, this capability also increases the risk of malicious prompt injection, where attackers can manipulate the model's responses by injecting deceptive prompts that persist across interactions. Trend Micro warns of critical Apex Central RCE vulnerability

Security 5 min read

Trend Micro has issued a warning about a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability affecting its Apex Central product. This security flaw could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on affected systems, posing significant risks to users. The vulnerability has been assigned a high severity rating, and Trend Micro has urged users to immediately apply available patches to mitigate the threat. The company has not disclosed specific technical details to prevent potential exploitation but emphasizes the importance of maintaining up-to-date security measures.
